summary: This is an email exchange between an Assistant United States Attorney and an FBI agent regarding the status of 3500 materials for the Ghislaine Maxwell case. The AUSA requests confirmation that materials will be received by September 15, 2021, and offers to schedule a call to discuss.

persons.name: Steve
persons.context: Addressed in an email from an AUSA regarding the submission of 3500 materials for the Maxwell case.

events.title: Deadline for 3500 materials submission
events.description: The Assistant United States Attorney references a deadline for receiving 3500 materials related to the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
keyFacts: The email discusses the preparation and submission of 3500 materials, which are discovery materials the prosecution must provide to the defense in a criminal case.
The correspondence is related to the case against Ghislaine Maxwell, indicating ongoing legal proceedings in September 2021.
The communication is between a federal prosecutor and an FBI agent, showing coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office and law enforcement.
The email includes a specific deadline of September 15, 2021, for receiving these materials.
